p: The antibacterial activity of all methanolic extracts of T. articulata was determined by using a well-known well-diffusion method. As summarized in Table 3, the methanolic extracts of different parts of T. articulata were significantly active against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacterial species. The highest antimicrobial activity was exhibited by methanolic extract of dry leaves of T. articulata (5 mg/ml) against both Gram-negative bacteria exhibit zone of inhibition (20.1 ± 0.30 mm, 19.9 ± 0.18 mm, 18.1 ± 0.18 mm against P. aeruginosa, K. pneumonia, E. coli) and Gram-positive bacteria (22.7 ± 0.23 mm, 25. 3 ± 0.34 mm, 19.4 ± 0.12 mm against S. aureus, S. epidermidis, S. pneumonia) respectively.
